title: Hatchy
author: Hatchy
content: Today, as we all celebrate and honor our fathers worldwide, let's take a moment to express our deepest gratitude to the father of Bitcoin, SATOSHI NAKOMOTO. thank you Satoshi, for giving us the remarkable gift of Bitcoin and ushering us into a new era of financial freedom. the freedom that Bitcoin brought, has driven us into a new money system free from the constraints of of the government and local banking systems. his vision and ingenuity have empowered Individuals all over the world including my self giving us a new means to transact and store valuables securely and independently.   on this special day, i want to also extend my appreciation to all father out there who have embraced Bitcoin and also educated their children about the importance of financial freedom of the  emerging technology like Bitcoin. cheers to us all

comments.author: www.Gambler.Casino
comments.body: I support! Bitcoin is a very ingenious "invention"!But behind the pseudonym Satoshi Nakamoto is most likely a large team.

comments.author: robelneo
comments.body: Quote from: www.Gambler.Casino on June 18, 2023, 10:17:40 PMI support! Bitcoin is a very ingenious "invention"!But behind the pseudonym Satoshi Nakamoto is most likely a large team.How likely is it that, Satoshi Nakamoto's identity is still under speculation we all thought he is an old man from Japan or Craig Wright, there was a thread I read he is from India and there's speculation that it's a NASA team but I support in greeting him a Happy Father's day because he is the founding father of Bitcoin and the Cryptocurrency community, so every year we should greet our founding father a Happy Father's day, as a way of thanking of bringing Bitcoin.

comments.author: SamReomo
comments.body: Quote from: Hatchy on June 18, 2023, 10:09:09 PM  Today, as we all celebrate and honor our fathers worldwide, let's take a moment to express our deepest gratitude to the father of Bitcoin, SATOSHI NAKOMOTO.Man, who told you that "SATOSHI NAKOMOTO," By the way the real name is Satoshi Nakamoto, is the father of Bitcoin? He isn't the father of Bitcoin but the creator of it, and no one could be father of digital things. I don't know why people are wishing Satoshi Nakamoto on father's day? The only right of wishing him happy father's day is limited to his own children I guess. And, I'm quite sure that his children might wished him happy father's day on 18th June. If you created the post out of compassion then that's a good thing, otherwise it's not needed to wish him as father of Bitcoin.

comments.author: 348Judah
comments.body: Am not saying Satoshi Nakamoto isn't a man or should not be celebrated, all i want to remind you OP is that Satoshi is believed to be a person or group of persons, he's pseudoanonymous, maybe we shouldn't be too forward or quick to conclude on his personality since nobody has his real identity to claim, in this regard I will rather expect you to wish all the forum's fathers we have a happy father day anniversary.

comments.author: posi
comments.body: Quote from: SamReomo on June 19, 2023, 10:15:03 AMQuote from: Hatchy on June 18, 2023, 10:09:09 PM  Today, as we all celebrate and honor our fathers worldwide, let's take a moment to express our deepest gratitude to the father of Bitcoin, SATOSHI NAKOMOTO.Man, who told you that "SATOSHI NAKOMOTO," By the way the real name is Satoshi Nakamoto, is the father of Bitcoin? He isn't the father of Bitcoin but the creator of it, and no one could be father of digital things. I don't know why people are wishing Satoshi Nakamoto on father's day? The only right of wishing him happy father's day is limited to his own children I guess. And, I'm quite sure that his children might wished him happy father's day on 18th June. If you created the post out of compassion then that's a good thing, otherwise it's not needed to wish him as father of Bitcoin.I see what you mean, but I've seen several articles that also use the term "father" when talking about bitcoin, and I don't see anything wrong with calling Satoshi the father of bitcoin. He seems too rigid in this, sometimes, create or born can be understood as almost the same, and people call him the father of bitcoin just because he wants to create more friendliness, nothing else. Father's Day and bitcoin, they really have nothing to do with each other, and the topic is really unnecessary. But it shouldn't be too upset when people pay homage to Satoshi for creating something as amazing as bitcoin.

comments.author: www.Gambler.Casino
comments.body: If the creator of Bitcoin Elon Musk, with a high probability someday Elon himself will say this and provide proofs

comments.author: avp2306
comments.body: Quote from: Hatchy on June 18, 2023, 10:09:09 PM  Today, as we all celebrate and honor our fathers worldwide, let's take a moment to express our deepest gratitude to the father of Bitcoin, SATOSHI NAKOMOTO. thank you Satoshi, for giving us the remarkable gift of Bitcoin and ushering us into a new era of financial freedom. the freedom that Bitcoin brought, has driven us into a new money system free from the constraints of of the government and local banking systems. his vision and ingenuity have empowered Individuals all over the world including my self giving us a new means to transact and store valuables securely and independently.   on this special day, i want to also extend my appreciation to all father out there who have embraced Bitcoin and also educated their children about the importance of financial freedom of the  emerging technology like Bitcoin. cheers to us allWe don't know his real identity yet so its awkward to great him like that, also he cannot read this post greetings so maybe its good if you just dedicate this to forum administrators, mods and to all  active forum members since they might be happy to read such post like this especially if no one great them in this special season.We all do agree that Satoshi's creation is really good since it change so many life and Bitcoin is really one of the greatest invention created by a person.

comments.author: xSkylarx
comments.body: No matter if Satoshi is he/she or a group of people, that person or group is really the father of Bitcoin, meaning we can still wish Satoshi a happy Father's Day as he did everything just to create Bitcoin, and without him, Bitcoin is not in the world. So no matter if we really don't know the true identity of Satoshi, it is still really significant to tell him about it.

comments.author: siedemtrzy
comments.body: Quote from: www.Gambler.Casino on June 19, 2023, 10:50:29 AMIf the creator of Bitcoin Elon Musk, with a high probability someday Elon himself will say this and provide proofsThat's one of the craziest theories about real identity of Satoshi.

comments.author: GideonGono
comments.body: Wellwe don't even know the real gender behind the pseudonym "Satoshi Nakamoto".Who knows maybe it is a large group or even a woman just like to hide behind that name.But we are all happy for the successful creation that Satoshi left behind for us.

comments.author: SamReomo
comments.body: Quote from: siedemtrzy on June 19, 2023, 12:14:52 PMQuote from: www.Gambler.Casino on June 19, 2023, 10:50:29 AMIf the creator of Bitcoin Elon Musk, with a high probability someday Elon himself will say this and provide proofsThat's one of the craziest theories about real identity of Satoshi.Everyone has their own theory regarding Satoshi, and this guy called Elon Musk as Satoshi. I must confirm you my friend that Elon Musk rejected the people's claims who called him Satoshi Nakamoto, and somehow he pointed that Nick Szabo had the same ideas like Satoshi and he could be Satoshi Nakamoto. However, I'm very sure that Nick also rejected those people's claims who considered him Satoshi.Some people recently considered Steve Jobs as Satoshi Nakamoto, and that was done only because Apple included a copy of Bitcoin whitepaper in their operating system. So, these allegations and claims will remain the part of the game and I'm very sure that the original Satoshi Nakamoto will remain anonymous. I don't think he even needs to reappear to confirm that he's the real creator of Bitcoin. His idea behind creation of Bitcoin came into light of the day and that's more than enough for him.

comments.author: Ambatman
comments.body: Quote from: Hatchy on June 18, 2023, 10:09:09 PMI want to also extend my appreciation to all father out there who have embraced Bitcoin and also educated their children about the importance of financial freedom of the  emerging technology like Bitcoin. cheers to us all What about a father who knows nothing/skeptical about BitcoinThey don't deserve to be appreciated?Educating kids about Bitcoin doesn't make a good fatherSatoshi never stated its gender(s)Its identity has always been a speculationWe can't really tellIt might even be a Lady or group of ladiesTo be sincere I don't really see a need for thisIt would have been better to just name it"Happy Father's Day"I won't be surprise when I seeHappy mother's day to BitcoinBecause she's the mother of all crypto.

comments.author: Ever-young
comments.body: Most of us just seems to take everything to the highest step which one could have not even imagined. This father's day celebration wishing Satoshi is not necessary to me, because we really want never can tell if the name is what made of a team of different genders or if it's a male, female or an entire organization.

comments.author: drwhobox
comments.body: Satoshi nakamoto's gender is not known or even Satoshi nakamoto can be a team you don't know. It doesn't feel right to wish Satoshi nakamoto on fathers day. The best thing is to wish your father to bring you in this world and give you chance to enjoy Satoshi Nakamoto's bitcoin.

comments.author: Asuspawer09
comments.body: Quote from: Hatchy on June 18, 2023, 10:09:09 PM  Today, as we all celebrate and honor our fathers worldwide, let's take a moment to express our deepest gratitude to the father of Bitcoin, SATOSHI NAKOMOTO. thank you Satoshi, for giving us the remarkable gift of Bitcoin and ushering us into a new era of financial freedom. the freedom that Bitcoin brought, has driven us into a new money system free from the constraints of of the government and local banking systems. his vision and ingenuity have empowered Individuals all over the world including my self giving us a new means to transact and store valuables securely and independently.   on this special day, i want to also extend my appreciation to all father out there who have embraced Bitcoin and also educated their children about the importance of financial freedom of the  emerging technology like Bitcoin. cheers to us allI guess it would make sense since Satoshi could be the Father or creator of Bitcoin or something like that   Happy Father's Day!We don't actually know anything about Satoshi Nakamoto's personal information, We don't know if he's a man or a woman, but based on his it just sounded like a man, so most people would actually assume that Satoshi is a man, but it was never really stated so Satoshi could actually be a woman probably. We don't know if Satoshi Nakamoto could actually be a Father he might actually have a son at some point, right? At this point all of this doesnt really matter anymore, in my opinion, it's better to be this way since claiming the Title Satoshi Nakamoto would affect Bitcoin, it might be difficult to prove this but it's surely possible I can see a lot of problems if that happened probably countless of cases, etc. But what really matters at this point is Bitcoin we all believe on it.

comments.author: adaseb
comments.body: Quote from: siedemtrzy on June 19, 2023, 12:14:52 PMQuote from: www.Gambler.Casino on June 19, 2023, 10:50:29 AMIf the creator of Bitcoin Elon Musk, with a high probability someday Elon himself will say this and provide proofsThat's one of the craziest theories about real identity of Satoshi.People already speculated this years ago and they even asked Elon himself and he denied it saying he is not Satoshi. However he is still fascinated with Bitcoin and why he owns some personally and not just Tesla.It’s been over a decade so we will most likely never determine who he is. Unless he sold small amounts I don’t think he ever cashed out any of the coins his mined early in 2009.

comments.author: jyakulis
comments.created_time: June 20, 2023, 12:44:54 PMLast edit: June 21, 2023, 03:45:00 AM by jyakulis
comments.body: Thanks, wish it wasn’t on a random site from a random faceless person but oh well.

comments.author: tread93
comments.body: This was a clever post, I don't think people usually refer to Satoshi as the father of anything just the creator of Bitcoin but technically speaking he is the father of cryptocurrency. Pretty neat!!!
